title: 404 errors with version 91.0.1
content:
Just updated Firefox from version 90.0.2 -> 91.0.1 on a Mac running OS 10.15.7.

I'm experiencing 404 errors of which do not occur in the previous version. Here's what the console shows...

Source map error: Error: request failed with status 404 Resource URL: https://MyWebsite.com/assets/vendor/bootstrap/css/bootstrap.min.css Source Map URL: bootstrap.min.css.map

I tried several things to try and isolate this issue, but all to no avail. The file does exist, and loads in the previous version of Firefox.

Any help would be greatly appreciate.

title: Firefox Doesn't Open GPX (GPS Exchange File)
content:
I'm setting up a website using the following code to open a GPX file using Garmin BaseCamp: 

<td>   <span class="TEXT-BOLD">GPS Track File:</span>   <br>   <a href="2018-11-03-Six_Saddles_Ride_track.gpx" target="_blank">GPX track file</a> </td>

When I click on the link, Firefox opens the file as a text file in a new window.

In the Tools - Settings - Applications area, I have set Firefox to open GPX files with Garmain BaseCamp. I have verified that the setting points to the Garmin BaseCamp file. If I click on the file in Windows File Explorer, it open with Garmin BaseCamp.

What did I do wrong?

title: Open with on file download silently fails
content:
If I click a link on a web page to download a file, Firefox offers me the option to "open with" a program or download to my downloads folder. I like having both options available but only one of them is working on the installation on one of my computers. If I choose the "open with" option, nothing happens. If I choose the download option, the file appears in my download folder and I can go there manually and open it.

I have tried reinstalling Firefox and running in troubleshooting mode. I have tried adjusting the application associations and actions in settings. If I tell it to always "open with" for a file type, I still get the download option dialog when I download something. I have not tried a Refresh because it is not clear how this interacts with my Firefox online profile and I don't want to remove settings on the other computers that are working fine.

This computer is Windows 10 and the problem is with "docx" and "pdf" files and others too.

title: Link colors (blue and purple) showing for text instead of black in Web pages
content: Problem: Using Firefox (version 91.0) the text on my web pages is either blue, or purple, (my default link colors) instead of the normal black. This just happened and I cannot link it to any specific activity on the computer. I have tried to correct this under "settings/colors", but none of these settings appeared to be wrong. I have systematically worked through the Mozilla support page entitled "troubleshooting & diagnose Firefox problems". Suggestions 1 through 5 , that is cleared cache, refreshed Firefox, downloaded new version of Firefox, etc, etc. have NOT solved this problem.This problem is not present on other browsers. I have also followed the Mozilla instructions for restoring the default colors using about:config and browser*color. Nothing has worked so far. I have not yet tried creating a new profile (suggestion #6), instead I'm opting to ask the community for help. My operating system is MacOS Big Sur Ver. 11.2.3. Thanks in advance for your help.

title: Access denied to Tesco
content:

Reference #18.3e330760.1629211681.19c464c4

I can fix the problem, at least temporarily, by deleting my browsing history and cookies, but this means having a fairly tedious time logging into the other sites I want to use - extra login codes sent to my phone, and so on.

The problem seems to be only with tesco.com and it also comes and goes - sometimes I can log in then, a few minutes later, I can't.

If I give in and use Edge, there is no problem. I would rather stick with Firefox, however.

Any remedy for this situation would be gratefully received.

title: Browser will not display websites with appropriate properties
content:
Hello,

I have a new issue with Firefox that began after a routine, small update to my Mac OS (Catalina 10.15.7). Please refer to the images provided, showing a normal view of a website in Chrome vs what I am seeing in Firefox.

  • Link colors are being overwritten by some default blue and purple
  • Graphical interface elements, such as the line underneath "All" in the navbar, do not appear
  • Black outlines are appearing where they do not normally, and elements that would be in a light gray are now black, etc

These issues are only limited to my Firefox browser and do not occur in other browsers I have installed. I have performed the Refresh Firefox function, and all of these issues are persisting. In things like Gmail, these black lines and flat/missing GUI elements essentially render it unusable.

I'm desperate for a solution.

title: Kein Chip-Video mehr
content: Seit ca 2 Tagen kann ich die Videos von Chip, "Newsletter Chip > im Brouser öffnen > Themen-Video" nicht mehr sehen. Nach Auswahl " Video" sieht die Maske aus als würde das Video oder der Werbe-Beitrag geladen, aber dann geschieht nichts. Meine Vermutung ist, dass das Sicherungskonzept derart verändert wurde, dass dieser Ablauf nicht mehr machbar ist. An welchen Stellen muss geschraubt werden, damit ich diese Videobeiträge wieder sehen kann. Aus dem Newsletter rufe ich folgende Webseite auf https://www.chip.de/news/Linux-Klassiker-landet-Volltreffer-Debian-11-Bullseye_117087855.html?utm_source=nl_chipd-dy&utm_medium=chip-newsletter&utm_campaign=16-08-2021%2B17%253A00%253A02&utm_content=nl_chipmob&utm_term= Konsole zeigt: Layout-Darstellung wurde erzwungen, bevor die Seite vollständig geladen war. Falls Stylesheet noch nicht geladen sind, kann dies zu einem kurzzeitigen Darstellung des Inhalts ohne Formatierung führen. Das Skript von "https://videoplayer.chip.de/p/player/latest/tfa.js?key=f6876ff40f5a74303c2b874c26eeb219bb08a0e6" wurde geladen, obwohl sein MIME-Typ ("text/html") kein für JavaScript gültiger MIME-Typ ist. Was kann ich machen?

title: Recently bookmarked list : where can I find the bookmarks before my last 10 - my 11th, 12th etc.
content: I have found a significant bug in Firefox bookmarks system that's occurred in one of the last updates. I am running Firefox 91.0 on a Windows 10 laptop PC and it updates automatically. In my work I have bookmarked about 43 sites in about the last month. Only 10 appear in "Recently Bookmarked". Until the last month or so, I would go to Manage Bookmarks and all my recent bookmarks (not just 10) would be displayed and I would be able to move them to different folders I have created in my bookmarks menu. When I do this now, Manage Bookmakrs shows is a much older set of unsorted bookmarks from October 2020 to May 2021, and none of the recent 43. If I go to Recently Bookmarked it shows only the 10. The other 33 seemed to have vanished. I then searched my own bookmarks menu (with about 150 folders in it) and found all the recent bookmarks were located in one particular folder. I haven't set Firefox to do this. Indeed I cannot find any bookmarks options tab to select where bookmarks are saved by default. Why has this happened? How do I get my recent bookmarks saved in Other Bookmarks like they used to be instead of what seems like a random place in my bookmarks menu? This is quite a recent problem - say the last 1-2 months, since a fairly major update I'd guess? I also noticed that if I go to the Open Applications Menu tab on the right of the screen, and click on Bookmarks, this dialogue box lists all 43 of my recent bookmarks, not just the last 10. Why does this list all recent and the Recently Bookmarked tab only lists 10?

title: Disable find results in the Firefox scrollbar
content:
Hello,

Since Firefox 87, the “Highlight All” feature on Find in Page now displays tick marks alongside your scrollbar that correspond to the location of matches found on that page. Source: https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/87.0/releasenotes/ So when I press Ctrl+F to find something then I check "Highlight All", I see the results in the scrollbar. I don't want to see these tick marks alongside my scrollbar. I prefer the old behavior.

How to go back to the old behavior please?

Thank you. Best regards.
creator: yugiohjcj1

title: tab preview on Firefox 91 has gone, not showing thumbnail pictures
content:
Hi all, I tend to have two different Firefox browser windows open as I toggle quite a bit (works faster for me than going to and from with the mouse). In the past up to version 89 on my FF for desktop I could hover (when using the mouse) over the one or other firefox and it showed me small preview pictures (the ones looking like what is called "tiles" from windows explorer) Since updating to v91 these have gone and all I see now is a list of text description of which tabs I have open in the one, and when toggling then a text line or lines of which tabs I have open there. I tried some solution already but all it did was packing all the text lines for both browser windows into one large pop-up at the bottom but not any pictures.

This might be a Windows issue but when searching for it I got overwhelmed with what seems a gazillion solutions and none for what I was looking for.

It would be great if you could let me know what to do to get these lovely little preview pictures back, they made my life soooo much easier! Thanks already for your replies :)
creator: m.schlecking

title: Wacom Cintiq Pro 24 not recognised by Ubuntu 20.04.2
content: I've been working around Ubuntu not recognising my Wacom Cintiq Pen-Display by continuing to use Ubuntu 18.04. (Early versions of Ubuntu 18 didn't recognise the screen either and I continued using Ubuntu 16.something, until a new release fixed the problem, then it broke again). Trying to find a solution I discovered that by switching off the screen and back on again after booting and logging in, Ubuntu then recognised it and worked. When image processing, I need to do the switch off-on before invoking Gimp. I guess Gimp configures its IO at start up so that is understandable. Is there a better way either to configure Ubuntu so that it recognises the cintiq screen correctly at start up, or can I (re)start the system service or deamon that interfaces to it without it switching off-on? Thanks for taking the trouble to look at this. Kind regards 13arry 13arker

creator: Kelstra

title: Firefox problems after Firefox and Windows 10 Updates
content:
Firefox version 89.0 updates to Firefox 89.0.2 and a feature update to Windows 10, Version 21H1 made Firefox load at crawl speed. Applying Firefox update 91.0 makes it impossible to retrieve book marks and history. I read the troubleshooting information and opted to Refresh Firefox instead.

All I have that I think I can trust is a folder from June 2021. I see multiple user profiles but the user folder; have not been able to restore any of them. Device is Lenovo E585 with i7 8550U and 16 GB RAM.

As many as eight Firefox icons appear in Task Manager when starting Firefox. Getting Firefox loaded takes several minutes. Loading a new pages regularly takes one to two minutes. Clicking History or Bookmarks does not return anything that looks like what was expected. No account ID shows up when the Firefox menu is opened. As nearly as I can tell, there was never a Firefox ID created because this computer's content was moved to it from a legacy computer.

Your insights and assistance are sought by a user whose body of knowledge pre-dates Windows 10, so please speak slowly and use small words (:-)
creator: fullerwp

title: How to add a exception for SSL certificate error
content: I am developing my web application locally under the url https://local.focuscura.com:5555. When I am trying to access the url I get a "Secure connection failed - SEC_ERROR_INADEQUATE_KEY_USAGE" error which is normal as the SSL certificate is not a valid one. But I would expect to have a "Add exception" button as I can see on Chrome and Edge for the same url. I tried settings the config parameter "network.stricttransportsecurity.preloadlist" to false and delete the SiteSecurityServiceState.txt as found in https://support.mozilla.org/bm/questions/1206414. But it does not work. I still cannot access that url and no "Add Exception" button is shown. I have FF 91 installed on Win 10.

title: Firefox home page search bar doesn't allow input.
content: Until recently, I was able to type in the search bar that appears in the middle of the page whenever I'm at the Firefox home page, but now any time I try to type or paste anything there, it automatically puts it in the address bar at the top. I can click on that bar, and a blinking cursor appears, indicating that I should be able to type there, but it still puts everything in the address bar. This only happens with that page, and nowhere else. Why is it doing this, and how to I make it stop doing that?

content: Firefox on Debian Linux with no modules or extensions enabled keeps installing a windows virus in it's cache. Other browsers don't do this so it's something with firefox.

title: Firefox 91.0 Dark & Light - Here we go again
content:
I have my Windows Colours settings as Custom which has Windows default mode as Dark and default app mode as Light and this has been working fine with FF until now!

The drop down lists on the Menu Bar are now showing everything in white text with a black background when I want it to show in black text with a white background which it used to do.

The URL area and background in new tabs show correctly with light background and dark text and if I use Edge or Chrome they also work correctly so what's been changed in FF ?!?

This used to work as I wanted but now I can't find any way to change it so if anyone has any suggestions on how I can fix this, that would be great.

Thanks.
